content.description: Perfect rock!  Sit start the face right of middle and move on great rock straight up.
content.protection: A good flat landing. Plenty of space for a pad.
content.location:
Immediately below the Nest.  The Nest is the large formation atop the high-point of Shelf Ridge North West of Couch Rock.

To reach the Nest, hike to Couch Rock and then head left and move down the trail along Shelf Ridge.  When the trail begins to head uphill, continue uphill towards the Nest, now in view and located at the top of the hill.

content.description: The right-hand side (arete) of the blockhead boulder.  With your right hand on the arete, use edges and slopers with the left hand to top-out.  A good problem that will become much better with some traffic.
content.location: Lord Blockhead is 0.55 miles from the Shelf Road parking lot on Gridley Road.  Having parked at the Shelf Road parking, hike up the road for 0.28 miles.  Leave the road and take the single track heading steeply uphill on the right.  Continue following the single track uphill and up the ridge for another 0.27 miles (this part takes a while due to the steepness of the trail) until the trail passes between the Blockhead Boulder on the left and the Californio boulder on the right.

content.description: Sit start the overhang.  Start off the "mini-hueco-hole" and move to the big two-handed shelf/jug.  Move off the shelf to slopers up high and mantle.  Starting at the shelf is maybe V2.
content.location: Immediately left of Lord Blockhead.  Dry heat is 0.55 miles from the Shelf Road parking lot on Gridley Road. Having parked at the Shelf Road parking lot, hike up the road for 0.28 miles. Leave the road and take the single track heading steeply uphill on the right. Continue following the single track uphill and up the ridge for another 0.27 miles (this part takes a while due to the steepness of the trail) until the trail passes between the Blockhead Boulder on the left and the Californio boulder on the right.

content.description: Start with your left hand crimped on the rail,  your right on the arête, and minimal feet. Slap up the arête to gain better feet then throw for the lip and mantle.
content.protection: There is a ditch behind you that can be a potential hazard to your ankles. So, a pad and a spotter.
content.location: As you approach the summit of Couch Rock go left into a clearing. The boulder is out of sight, but straight ahead about 100 yards.

content.description: Move up and slightly right across the low angle face.  Somewhat highball, and quite dirty.  Bring a nice big nylon bristle brush.
content.location: Chocolatero is 0.55 miles from the Shelf Road parking lot on Gridley Road. Having parked at the Shelf Road parking, hike up the road for 0.28 miles. Leave the road and take the single track heading steeply uphill on the right. Continue following the single track uphill and up the ridge for another 0.27 miles (this part takes a while due to the steepness of the trail) until the trail passes between the Blockhead Boulder on the left and the Californio boulder on the right.  The Chocolatero face is the North face of the Californio boulder.

content.description:
Sit start the crack/ seam with the left hand in the crack/sidepull.  Smearing and edging with the feet, use crimps to gain an insecure hand jam up high.  Slopers can be used instead of jamming but this makes the problem more difficult.

The standing start is excellent as well and goes at perhaps V2.
content.location: Californio is 0.55 miles from the Shelf Road parking lot on Gridley Road. Having parked at the Shelf Road parking lot, hike up the road for 0.28 miles. Leave the road and take the single track heading steeply uphill on the right. Continue following the single track uphill and up the ridge for another 0.27 miles (this part takes a while due to the steepness of the trail) until the trail passes between the Blockhead Boulder on the left and the Californio boulder on the right.  Californio is facing back towards shelf road.  It may be hard to spot chalk marks on Californio from the trail, so use the blockhead boulder as a landmark.  Once the blockhead boulder is seen just left of the trail, head down and right until you see the Californio crack.

content.description: Start where the red rock is stuck halfway into the face at about waist high.  Move up and left.  Tall and dirty.
content.location: Blasted into Tibet is 0.55 miles from the Shelf Road parking lot on Gridley Road. Having parked at the Shelf Road parking, hike up the road for 0.28 miles. Leave the road and take the single track heading steeply uphill on the right. Continue following the single track uphill and up the ridge for another 0.27 miles (this part takes a while due to the steepness of the trail) until the trail passes between the Blockhead Boulder on the left and the Californio boulder on the right.  Blasted into Tibet is on the North face of the Californio boulder.
